tit.e: Itabuki no Miya Palace (an ancient Imperial Palace where Empress Kogyoku lived in about the middle of the seventh century)
Itabuki no Miya Palace (an ancient Imperial Palace where Empress Kogyoku lived in about the middle of the seventh century)

sen.j: 板蓋宮（いたぶきのみや）は、7世紀中葉に皇極天皇が営んだ宮。
sen.e: Itabuki no Miya was an Imperial Palace Emperor Kogyoku lived in about the middle of the seventh century.

sen.j: 一般には飛鳥板蓋宮と呼称される。
sen.e: It is generally called Asuka no Itabuki no Miya.
sen.cmt: 「飛鳥板蓋宮」の読みは、広辞苑から引用しました。

sen.j: 奈良県明日香村岡にある飛鳥京跡にあったと伝えられている。
sen.e: It was reportedly located in the Asukakyo Site in Oka, Asuka-mura, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 642年1月、皇極天皇は夫である舒明天皇の崩御（死）により即位し、同年9月19日、大臣である蘇我蝦夷（そがのえみし）へ新宮殿を12月までに建設するよう命じた。
sen.e: In February 642, Emperor Kogyoku ascended the throne succeeding her husband, Emperor Jomei who had died and on October 20, in the same year, she ordered Oomi SOGA no Emishi to construct a new Palace by December.

sen.j: 板蓋宮は、645年6月12日 (旧暦)に発生したクーデター（乙巳の変）の舞台となった。
sen.e: Itabuki no Miya became the setting for a coups (Isshi no hen (the Murder in the Year of Isshi)) which occurred on July 13, 645.

sen.j: この日、皇極天皇の眼前で大臣の次期後継者である蘇我入鹿が刺殺されるという凶行がなされた。
sen.e: On this day, an act of violence to stab to death SOGA no Iruka, inheritor to Oomi was committed in front of Emperor Kogyoku.
On this day, an act of violence to stab to death SOGA no Iruka, the inheritor to the Oomi was committed in front of Empress Kogyoku.

sen.j: これにより皇極天皇は同月14日に退位し、事件の真の首謀者と目される軽皇子（かるのみこ）が即位することとなった（孝徳天皇）。
sen.e: Due to this, Emperor Kogyoku abdicated the throne on the 15th of the same month and it was decided that Karu no Miko who was regarded as the real leader of the coups ascend the throne (Emperor Kotoku).

sen.j: 孝徳天皇は、難波長柄豊碕（なにわのながらのとよさき）に宮を置いた。
sen.e: Emperor Kotoku set up his Palace in Naniwa no Nagara no Toyosaki.

sen.j: 654年（白雉5）10月孝徳天皇が難波宮で没すると翌年の初めに皇極上皇は板蓋宮において再度即位（重祚）し、斉明天皇となった。
sen.e: After Emperor Kotoku died at Naniwa no Miya in November 654, the retired Emperor Kogyoku ascended the throne again (Choso (a second accession to the imperial throne)) at Itabuki no Miya early in the following year, becoming Emperor Saimei.

sen.j: この年の末に板蓋宮は火災に遭い、焼失した。
sen.e: At the end of that year, a fire broke out at Itabuki no Miya, which was burnt down.

sen.j: 斉明天皇は川原宮へ遷った。
sen.e: Emperor Saimei moved into Kawahara no Miya.
Empress Saimei moved into Kawahara no Miya Palace.

sen.j: なお、名称「板蓋宮」は、文字どおり屋根に板（豪華な厚い板）を葺いていたことに由来すると言われている。
sen.e: Furthermore, the name, 'Itabuki no Miya' is said to derive from the fact that the Palace was roofed with shingle.
Furthermore, the name, 'Itabuki no Miya' (shingle roofed palace) is said to derive from the fact that the palace was actually roofed with shingle (thick and luxurious shingle).
sen.cmt: 用語補足などしました。
sen.e: Furthermore, the name, 'Itabuki no Miya' (shingle roofed palace) is said to derive from the fact that the palace was actually roofed with shingle (thick and luxurious shingle).

sen.j: このことにより、当時の屋根のほとんどは草葺き・茅葺き・藁葺きであり、板葺きの屋根の珍しかったことが判る。
sen.e: By the above fact, it becomes clear that most of the houses at that time were thatched with grass, kaya-grass or straw and houses with shingle-covered roof were rare.
